content.description: Apparently this is listed as an un-named 5.9 in the '95 Bouldering Guide. I think this is a lot harder than 5.9, it is possible some holds could have disappeared...my personal opinion is V3-4.

Start along the traversing crack and climb up and around the corner onto the face following the bolts. short but sweet, this route is worth hiking to. Use the sling on other side of boulder to aid up to the top and sling the boulders on top for an anchor. this is a slab climb with very small holds. This climb appears in the Fry Guide but it is unnamed and I only named it to help with the confusion of where to find boulders here due to the many splitting trails. this climb is a very obvious marker on the trail and giving it a name helps that much more.
content.protection: bolts and large boulder to sling.
content.location: located a few hundred feet down hill from the aid boulder. when the trail gets pinched and you have to squeeze through the gap you know you've reached "slim jim". clip into fixed sling and down climb back of boulder to get down.

content.description: start by standing on the boulder left of no fat chicks and rock over on a high right foot. The crux is getting off the ground. Once off, use friction and small crimps to climb to the top
content.protection: Set up a top rope anchor on the large block on top of the climb
content.location: middle of the aid hill to the left of no fat chicks. The start is as far left as you can go on the face standing on the boulder

content.description: start as a lie back then get inside for a short but fun off width, there are a couple of foot chips and tiny ledges. crux is the off width section but easy finish.
content.location: on aid hill on top and behind the aid boulder. once up there pass "girl in the curl" and it sits on top and to the left of that climb. -alternate route- pass "pizza face" and continue down the trail, pass "girl in the curl" and head up and right.

content.description: choss, easy, had many things break, but what's left is good and kinda fun. good problem if you are new to climbing. Careful standing on the surrounding boulders, i had about 150 lb rock break off that i was standing on and it crashed into my leg, luckily the angle was good and it did not break my leg.
content.location: if you are standing at grumpy man and looking north it will be the first boulder in view.

content.description: start up against the tree and as low a possible. use small foot a few inches off the ground.
content.location: down trail from "NO Fat Chicks" above the washed out, off chamber area. almost faces the old bolted face with missing hangers.

content.description: Start on the kinda sharp orange inclusion and traverse left until you have to mantel up. The crux is getting on top. In the beginning of the climb there is a move where you press your knee into your hand, this was necessary for all 4 of us climbing that day.
content.protection: pads and spotter to move them
content.location: If you are at pizza face keep going over the hill and instead of taking the trail right, go left along and down some boulders and find the trail down hill. take it about 100 feet or so.

content.description: start on the large triangle shaped hold all the way next to the manzanita tree. Traverse across the arete using heel hooks and small ledges. Mantle up on the last large obvious hold with a black inclusion smearing feet on the polished slabby part.
content.location: right below "Big Day at Pink House", it's the next boulder down the trail. There is a one move mantle boulder before you get to this one.

content.description: This is a very fun arete with 2 cruxes and strong powerful moves all the way up. first crux is about 3 moves up 2nd is just before traversing out left. There used to be a sharp tree branch sticking out of the ground that almost got jeff hence the name.
content.location: This climb is downhill from no fat chicks, it is the arete on the right side of the trail just before big day at pink house.

content.description:
Start on good horizontal jug rail with bad feet. Big move left to a vertical seam, then work your way up to the scoop/shelf below the high point of the boulder. High quality for El Coriso standards.

The original FA finished by matching the shelf then traversing left around the arete - weiner finish. Kevin did the 2nd by turning the right arete out onto the airy slab with feet on the seam/crack, traverse the seam with no hands to the right and finishing up the right side of the slab/arete - don't fall. No body has done the strong man/woman direct finish up the marble smooth scoop.
content.location: On your way from first hill towards aid hill. After Shin splints, switch foot, mohawk kid, you will approach a smoooooth boulder on your right before going down a steep section of trail. The problem is on the right side squeezed in by another block.

content.description: I have not climbed this yet because it needs new bolts but it looks great, and I wanted to post it to gain some interest.
content.protection: bolts, needs new bolts to be protected to reach the bolts climb up at the far end of the boulder just behind castration. or be a boss and climb castration!
content.location: down trail from 'slim jim' about 200 yards. it is on the right side of the trail adjacent to a very large boulder pile. If you look in the southern california bouldering guide by Craig Fry I think its the 5.11 face adjacent to monkey see, monkey do.

content.description: Pretty straight forward, crux for me was mid way to the top where the crack gets super thin/dies out.
content.location: Down the trail from Foot Loose on the left side of the trail. Down climb on the trail left side of boulder.
